notes.reading-notes:
SAMPLE NOTES ON READING PASSAGE
TOPIC: a type of irresponsible and sensational journalism called yellow journalism
techniques used to create yellow journalism:
journalists present one side, emphasize lurid details, exaggerate facts, fail to check facts
newspapers put sensational stories on front page, use sensational banner headlines and photos
notes.listening-notes:
SAMPLE NOTES ON LISTENING PASSAGE
TOPIC: how yellow journalism came about
history of yellow journalism:
battle for circulation between Joseph Pulitzer's New York World and William Randolph Hearst's New York Journal in 1890s using sensational stories
popular Yellow Kid cartoon in Pulitzer's New York World
sensational journalism called "yellow" because of cartoon
